item.title: My Agifier (2nd C++ Program)
item.dc:creator: @Lin Lin
item.description:
@Lin wrote:

Ok. I got a new C++ Compiler and I can finally code. I remade my Agifier, which tells you how old you’ll be in a year you choose. Here’s the code.

[code]#include <stdio.h>

int main () {
int age;
int year = 2007;
int futureyear;
int added;
int yeartwo;
int finalage;
int twoadded;
puts(“Welcome to this Agifier by Lin!!!\n\n”);
puts(“Please enter your age.”);
scanf("%d", &age);
puts(“Now enter the future year.”);
scanf("%d", &futureyear);
added = age + futureyear;
age + futureyear;
finalage = added - year;
futureyear - year;
twoadded = finalage - age;
finalage - age;
printf(“You will be %d in the year %d\n\n”, finalage, futureyear);
puts(“Press Enter to continue.”);
getchar();
puts("____________________________________________________\n\n");
main();
return false;
}[/code] I need a rating on it. The only hard part was figuring out the math to actually get the age.

So if you decide to rate, thanks. Remember this is only my second program

~Lin

PS: It’s a code sample so it should be allowed here
